page.title: 08RELIGION
page.content: ST .LAWRENCES CHURCH St Lawrences Church was built about 100 years ago.The Church is Anglican which is nearly the same as a Catholic church apart from the way the Church is set out.The altar is set right back and the priest has his back to the congregation.The choir isn't in a loft but is at the front,sideways on,with the pews like any other church, in rows.The stained glass windows are about as old as the church apart from from the ones in St Mary's Chapel which have St Cecelia and her choir of angels on them.In St.Lawrence's Parish there are about 7000 parishioners.The church is one of the biggest parish churches in York.It is often called The Minster Without The City Walls.The spire can be seen from all around the area.In the churchyard stands the tower of the medieval church.
